news.title: Tesla already had big problems. Then Musk went to battle with Trump
news.summary: Tesla has spent much of the year dealing with struggling sales and a deteriorating brand. Now CEO Elon Musk has drawn the ire of the president.

news.title: Slate Auto: Inside the EV startup, stealth production facility backed by Jeff Bezos
news.summary: Slate Auto hopes its modular, stripped-down vehicle will be the future of affordable EVs. Slate Auto's modular vehicle has a long road ahead.

news.title: 'Bitcoin Family' hides crypto codes etched onto metal cards on four continents after recent kidnappings
news.summary: After a wave of crypto kidnappings, the ‘Bitcoin Family’ replaced its old security system with a decentralized, analog setup spread across four continents.

news.title: Morgan Stanley upgrades this mining stock as best pick to play rare earths
news.summary: Rare earth elements are at the center of the U.S.-China trade fight. They are crucial for electric vehicles and other advanced technology.

news.title: Trump presses Fed chief Powell to cut interest rate by full point despite strong jobs report
news.summary: The number of U.S. jobs that was higher than expected makes it unlikely that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates soon. An increase in the number of US jobs that were higher thanexpected makes it likely that the Fed will cut rates.

news.title: A professor testing ChatGPT’s, DeepSeek’s and Grok’s stock-picking skills suggests stockbrokers should worry
news.summary: Alejandro Lopez-Lira has been impressed with how current AI models can trade markets. He has created a video series to show how the technology can be used in the future.

news.title: I help my elderly mother every day and drive her to appointments. Can I recoup my costs from her estate?
news.summary: “I don’t want to upset her while she’s living. Stress makes her condition worse,” she says.

news.title: Republicans want to curb federal student loans — and private lenders are ready to step in
news.summary: It's been a dream in some right-leaning corners of the U.S. political sphere to privatize the student-loan system.

news.title: I bought my mother-in-law a condo — and she took out a $30,000 car loan. Now she refuses to get a roommate.
news.summary: “She has received a small inheritance, an annuity and also receives Social Security so she’s not penniless,” the family says.

news.title: Apple’s WWDC is a chance to change investors’ minds. Can the company deliver?
news.summary: Apple’s stock has been dogged by concerns that the company is behind the curve on AI. Apple is one of the most valuable companies in the world, valued at more than $1 trillion.
